intro: Cynanchum rungweense, commonly known as Rungwe milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its latex is milky and can be toxic, which is a common feature among plants in this family. Cynanchum rungweense is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in semi-arid conditions.
